intro: Agonandra engleri, commonly known as the Engler's agonandra, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered white flowers and elliptical, leathery leaves. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
